operator.title: Condition
operator.synopsis: This is the Condition Operator, which is used to check if a compare condition is true or false.

text.paragraph: This Condition Operator receive the step object from its parent operator through input Model Port, add the compare condition to the step model, and return two new routes which indicates the True or False of its compare condition.
This Operator gets the current step model from the input Pack, create a new Condition Node with its data input, connect itself with its parent, and add this new node to the step's nodes list.
Important: this operator is building the step model, without any calculation or training, no results or data will be generated.

inputPorts.port: The input Pack object, which contains the current step model, the parent where this Pack was generated, and the route indicator[Yes, No] from the parent.
Receives a String object, containing the name of the left operand, which is the first operand of the compare condition.

outputPorts.port: Outputs a Pack object, which contains the current step model with the new Condition Node added, the parent is set to this new node, and the route indicator is set to Yes.
Outputs a Pack object, which contains the current step model with the new Condition Node added, the parent is set to this new node, and the route indicator is set to No.
Outputs a String object, containing the name of the result of the compare condition.

parameters.parameter: Input or select the compare operator here, e.g. > =.
Input or select the right operand here, normally a number, e.g. 5.
Input the name of the result here, e.g. "RBBB".
Select the name of the focused lead here, e.g. "II". (Doing this will add a lead tag to the input string of data.)
